cells.data:
## Test as you go
- Code a little, then test.
- In the end, this saves time and frustration because if a test fails, you know that error is rooted in the little bit of new code you just wrote.
- Otherwise, you have to search through a lot of code, find an error, run the code again only to see that it still fails, search to find another error, and so on.

## Plotting
- Data visualizes that relates size of input to runtime.
- Helps determine how good a program is.
- Want to avoid exponential plots.
